3.text: No dialogue for this special dungeon.

5.name: Narration
5.text:
They shook their massive bodies and
indiscriminately pounded the houses. With bodies
exceeding three meters in height, there was no
sense of intelligence or dignity, just swinging a
log-like club in frustration.

6.name: Narration
6.text:
A swing of the log blew away the houses, shattered
the stone walls, and in an instant, the pitiful
goblin caught in between turned into a lump of
flesh.

7.name: Narration
7.text:
And then, the enraged giants recognized Sol and
the others. Drooling, they only envisioned
greedily devouring fine meat, and fiercely
attacked...!

9.name: Narration
9.text:
Their massive legs were crushed, their proud clubs
snapped in half, and with blood gushing from their
noses, the ogres were made to realize who they had
picked a fight with.

10.name: Narration
10.text:
The giant crawls on the ground, wearing a vulgar
smile and begging for forgiveness. However, the
adventurers are not so naive as to truly forgive
them.

11.name: Narration
11.text:
At the center of their ugly faces, a thick arrow
pierced between their eyes. The arrow released
from the hunter's longbow destroyed the ogre's
brainstem without missing its mark.

13.name: Narration
13.text:
Before their eyes stood a monstrously grotesque
creature. Merely looking at it would steal one's
sanity, suck on human brains, and feed on memories
and emotions... It was a being that could never
coexist with the living.

14.name: Narration
14.text:
The golden dragon and the adventurers guided by
her cast off their fear, summoned their courage,
and tightened their grip on their swords. If we
don't defeat this thing, we have no future...!

16.name: Narration
16.text:
The fierce staff sweeps overhead. The warrior,
narrowly avoiding it, thrusts the longsword with a
flash of determination. The sword, piercing to the
base of the grotesque body, delivers a decisive
and fatal blow. However, the monster musters its
final strength.

17.name: Narration
17.text:
Just before the wicked tentacles could attack the
warrior... the monster's body is engulfed in
flames. It screams, scatters a savory smell, and
writhes in agony. Confirming that its wicked life
has ended, the warrior gives a thumbs-up and
breaks into a smile at the golden dragon's child
who saved them at the last moment.
